page.title: 01Llanrug and Bethel
page.content: This lowland region north west of Caernarfon is mainly used for the rearing of cattle and sheep. Ocassionally, kale or potatoes are grown. There is one coniferous plantation. Most fields are divided by dry stone walls and netting fences. The two straggling villages have new private housing estates in them now for people employed in Caernarfon which is also used as their shopping area. The River Seront which flows from south east to north west has a wide valley floor which floods seriously each winter.
